desc:
Perform Affinity Propagation Clustering of data.
Read more in the User Guide.

params.name: damping
params.desc: Damping factor (between 0.5 and 1) is the extent to which the current value is maintained relative to incoming values (weighted 1 - damping). This in order to avoid numerical oscillations when updating these values (messages).

params.name: convergence_iter
params.desc: Number of iterations with no change in the number of estimated clusters that stops the convergence.

params.name: copy
params.desc: Make a copy of input data.

params.name: preference
params.desc: Preferences for each point - points with larger values of preferences are more likely to be chosen as exemplars. The number of exemplars, ie of clusters, is influenced by the input preferences value. If the preferences are not passed as arguments, they will be set to the median of the input similarities.

params.name: affinity
params.desc: Which affinity to use. At the moment precomputed and euclidean are supported. euclidean uses the negative squared euclidean distance between points.

attrs.name: affinity_matrix_
attrs.desc: Stores the affinity matrix used in fit.

attrs.name: n_iter_
attrs.desc: Number of iterations taken to converge.
